isis.stitle: TSI 03-09-03 - Hood/Fender Repair, Fender Section Replacement

geninfo.para: This TSI describes how to remove and replace the left or right side fender section of the hood/fender assembly on 4000, 7000, 8000 models listed above, 9200 and 9400 Models (after July 1996), and 9100 Model (after March 1997) when the fender section is damaged.

note.para: To complete the removal and replacement of a fender section, the following materials and equipment will be necessary: Fusor repair adhesive, adhesive application gun, heat gun (250 degrees), putty knife, hammer, C-clamps, 180-grit sandpaper, clean rags, masking tape, cutting disk and/or saw, face mask, and rubber gloves.
To order Fusor Adhesive MATERIAL SAFETY DATA SHEETS (MSDS), contact Fusor at 1-800-234-FUSOR. To order Fusor Adhesive, refer to Parts Letter G-19-4577-A.

svcprocinfo.para: Before removing and replacing the left or right side fender section of the hood/fender assembly, certain hood/fender components will have to be removed.

svcsubproc.title: MATERIALS AND EQUIPMENT REQUIRED
svcsubproc.para: To complete the removal and replacement of a fender section, the following materials and equipment will be necessary: Fusor T20 or T21 adhesive, adhesive application gun, heat gun (250 degrees), putty knife, hammer, C-clamps, 180 grit sandpaper, clean rags, masking tape, cutting disk and/or saw, face mask, rubber gloves and alcohol.

note.para: When possible, apply the heat to the piece of the fender section that is being removed.

step1.para: Remove the hood. For hood and fender removal instructions refer to Group 9, Front End, in the Master Service Manual for the model being serviced.
Before removing the splash panel bracket from the damaged fender section, measure and mark the position of the splash panel bracket on the new fender section.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Use Heat Gun to Heat Splash Panel Bracket

warning.para: To avoid possible personal injury, wear protective clothing, use safety glasses, face mask and rubber gloves during this procedure.
Use a NIOSH or MSHA approved respirator to avoid breathing dust and fumes.
Work in a separate area away from other operations.

step1.para: Use a heat gun ( Item 3, Figure 1) and heat the splash panel bracket ( Item 1, Figure 1). While heating the splash panel bracket, use a putty knife to push between the fender section and the splash panel bracket to separate it from the fender section. Remove the splash panel bracket. If not damaged, save for re-installation. Follow this procedure for the rear reinforcement.

important.para: When cutting the old fender section off, take special care cutting around the headlight box on all models. When installing a new fender section for a 9200 Model, care must be taken when cutting the rear edge of fender section from the bottom of the fender side support bracket to the top of the hood. These pieces will be used as templates to drill headlight mounting holes and cutting off rear fender section during INSTALLATION.

step1.para: From inside the hood, use a saw and/or cutting disk to cut the fender section away as close as possible to the top of the hood ( Figure 2) and the front hood support and side hood support ( Figure 3). Figure 4 shows fender section after fender cut away.

figure.caption: Figure 2. Cut Fender Section Away
Figure 3. Front and Side Hood Support
Figure 4. Fender Section

step1.para: Using a cutting disk, score through the fender section remaining at the side hood support ( Figure 4). Be careful not to cut into the side hood support. This will make it easier to heat and remove the remaining fender section pieces.
Use a heat gun ( Item 1, Figure 5) and heat the fender section piece ( Item 2, Figure 5) on the side hood support ( Item 3, Figure 5).

figure.caption: Figure 5. Heat Fender Section Piece

step1.para: Use a hammer and putty knife and work the putty knife between the fender pieces and side hood support and remove the fender pieces ( Figure 6).

figure.caption: Figure 6. Work Putty Knife Between Fender Pieces

step1.para: Starting at the rear edge of the hood/fender assembly, use a heat gun ( Item 1, Figure 7) to heat the fender section piece ( Item 2, Figure 7) from inside the hood. Push a putty knife between the top of the hood ( Item 3, Figure 7) and the fender pieces to separate them. Be careful not to crack the top of the hood. Work toward the grille surround at the front of the hood.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Separate Fender Pieces

step1.para: Where the fender section piece ( Item 1, Figure 8) is bonded to both the side hood support ( Item 2, Figure 8) and top of the hood (Item 3, Figure 8), heat will also need to be applied to the hood top. Be careful not to over-heat hood top. Be careful not to crack the top of the hood while working the putty knife between the top of the hood and fender section.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Fender Section at Hood Top and Side Hood Support

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. FENDER SECTION AT HOOD TOP AND SIDE HOOD SUPPORT

step1.para: Using a cutting disk, cut out the fender section and score through the fender section remaining at the front hood support. Be careful not to cut into the front hood support. This will make it easier to heat and remove the remaining fender section pieces ( Figure 9).

figure.caption: Figure 9. Remove Remaining Fender Section Pieces

step1.para: Heat the fender section pieces at the front hood support, and with the putty knife, remove the fender pieces ( Figure 9).

Where the fender section is bonded to both the grille surround and front hood support, heat will need to be applied to both sides. Being careful not to over-heat the grille surround, heat the grille surround and back side of the front hood support ( Figure 10).

figure.caption: Figure 10. Heat Grille Surround And Back Side Of Front Hood Support

step1.para: Use a small hammer and work the putty knife between the grille surround and fender section and between the front hood support and fender section. Be careful not to crack the grille surround while working the putty knife between the fender section and grille surround ( Figure 10).

Continue to apply heat to both the grille surround and front hood support. Use the putty knife and pliers and work the fender section piece out from between the grille surround and front hood support.

svcsubproc.title: PREPARATION AND CLEANING OF HOOD AND NEW FENDER SECTION

step1.para: Once the damaged fender section is removed, use a sanding disk and clean the remaining adhesive from between the grille surround and front hood support, front hood support, side hood support and inside surface of hood top where the new fender section will be secured with adhesive. Then with a lint-free cloth with alcohol, clean these surfaces and scuff with 180 grit sandpaper ( Figure 11).

figure.caption: Figure 11. Clean These Surfaces

step1.para: Use a clean, lint-free cloth with alcohol to clean the surfaces on both inside and outside the new fender section where it will be secured with adhesive to the grille surround, hood top, front hood support and side hood support, then scuff these surfaces with 180 grit sandpaper ( Figure 12).

figure.caption: Figure 12. Scuff These Surfaces

step1.para: Use a clean, dry, lint-free cloth to wipe any loose fiberglass and dust from the grille surround, hood top, front hood support, side hood support and the new fender section before applying the adhesive.

warning.para: Avoid contact with eyes, skin and clothing. Avoid breathing vapor or mist. Do not breath dust. Use with adequate ventilation and appropriate breathing apparatus. Refer to Fusor Corporate Material Safety Data Sheet before using this material. Fusor may be contacted by calling 1-800-234-Fusor. More information can be found on the ISIS ® web site (Supplier→ Fusor).

step1.para: Before applying any adhesive to the hood top ( Item 1, Figure 13) or new fender section ( Item 2, Figure 13), slide the new fender section into position on the hood and check the fit. Use clamps ( Item 3, Figure 13) to hold it in place.

figure.caption: Figure 13. Use Clamps to Hold Fender Section in Position

step1.para: Apply masking tape ( Item 4, Figure 13) to the grille surround ( Item 5, Figure 13) and the hood section just below the grille surround, then apply masking tape from the grille surround to rear edge of the hood top ( Item 1, Figure 13).

With the new fender section ( Item 2, Figure 13) trial fit in place, apply masking tape horizontally ( Item 4, Figure 13) to the new fender section, starting at the front edge of the fender section to the rear edge of the fender section.
Also apply masking tape vertically ( Item 4, Figure 13) to the new fender section ( Item 2, Figure 13), starting at the top front edge of the fender section to the bottom of the new fender section.
Remove the new fender section from the hood ( Figure 14).

figure.caption: Figure 14. Apply Adhesive

step1.para: Apply Fusor adhesive in-between the grille surround and front hood support, then apply adhesive to mating surfaces with the new fender section on the front hood support, side hood support and inside hood top ( Figure 14).

Once the adhesive has been applied, with assistance from a co-worker, position the front of the new fender section between the grille surround and front hood support, then position the offset of the fender section behind the hood top and clamp the fender section in place at the front, rear and side hood support ( Figure 13).

With the new fender section ( Item 1, Figure 15) held against the side hood support ( Item 2, Figure 15), drill the hood latch strap mounting holes ( Item 3, Figure 15) into the new fender section using the holes in the side hood support as a template. Install the 3 hood latch strap hex bolts and nuts to secure the fender section to the side hood support.

figure.caption: Figure 15. New Fender Section Against Side Hood Support

step1.para: Use a piece of plastic or wood to remove the excess adhesive from the seam between the top of the hood and the new fender section. Also remove excess adhesive from the grille surround and the front of the fender section before it starts to cure ( Figure 16).

figure.caption: Figure 16. Remove Excess Adhesive

step1.para: Use the measurements and markings on the new fender section to position properly the splash panel bracket ( Item 1, Figure 17) on the new fender section ( Item 2, Figure 17).

figure.caption: Figure 17. Position Splash Panel Bracket

step1.para: Apply adhesive to mounting surfaces on the splash panel bracket ( Item 1, Figure 17) and position it properly on the new fender section ( Item 2, Figure 17) and press firmly onto new fender section. Use duct tape to help hold it in place.
Remove the masking tape ( Item 1, Figure 18) from the grille surround, hood section just below the grille surround, hood top and from the new fender section ( Items 2, 3 and 4, Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Remove Masking Tape

step1.para: Allow the adhesive to cure for at least 4 hours before removing the clamps ( Item 5, Figure 18).

note.para: At 70 degrees the adhesive will fully cure in 24 to 48 hours (or one hour at 140°F/60°C).

step1.para: Make a template locally from old headlight box on old fender section, if not damaged. If damaged, use other headlight box to make template. Drill the holes in the new fender section headlight box for the headlight/turn signal assembly and mud guard ( Figure 19).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Drill Holes in Headlight Box

step1.para: If the hood is a 9200, use the rear piece from the old fender section saved while cutting old fender section off. Use it as template to mark the rear of the new fender section so it can be cut off properly ( Figure 20).

figure.caption: Figure 20. Use Rear Piece of Old Fender Section as a Template

step1.para: Using a cutting disk, cut off the new fender section as marked ( Figure 21).

figure.caption: Figure 21. Cut Off New Fender Section as Marked

step1.para: Using a sander, sand off the new fender section to smooth and finish the edges ( Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Smooth and Finish Edges

svcsubproc.title: HOOD COMPONENT RE-INSTALLATION
svcsubproc.para: Once the adhesive has cured properly, re-install the hood latch strap, product logo, headlight/turn signal assembly, mud guard, splash panel and tilt assist spring assembly bracket. Follow the instructions found in Group 9, Front End, in the Master Service Manual for the model being serviced.
